items.title: Eleven Bay Area Health Officers to Lift Most Indoor Mask Mandates on February 16
items.summary: In alignment with the State, the Bay Area counties of Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Monterey, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Cruz, Solano, Sonoma, and the City of Berkeley will lift universal mask requirements for most indoor public settings beginning Wednesday, February 16.

items.title: Local COVID-19 Relief Tops $200 Million; County Budget Outlook Positive As Economy Shows Signs of Improvement
items.summary: Board of Supervisors Gets First Look at 2021-23 Children’s BudgetFeb. 8, 2022Redwood City – The County of San Mateo has channeled more than $218 million to local relief efforts since the COVID-19 pandemic began.

items.title: Do You Identify as an Immigrant? County of San Mateo Launches Survey in 12 Languages to Help Assess Services, Learn What’s Needed
items.summary:
Did you know that one in three San Mateo County residents was born in another country?



If you identify as an immigrant, the County’s Board of Supervisors wants to hear from you.



Today, the County invites immigrants who live in San Mateo County – plus all who work or go to school here – to take a survey that will help shape services and resources.

items.title: Building Connections and Community
items.summary: Rebuilding Middlefield Road as the "Smartest Street" in the Nation

items.title: COVID-19 Testing: Widely Available, New Partner at  San Mateo County Event Center
items.summary: Along with vaccination, testing for the virus that causes COVID-19 remains vital to slow the spread of the disease and to help all of us safely work, attend school and enjoy the things we love.To highlight the importance of testing, the County of San Mateo today announces a new provider at the San Mateo County Event Center that will be able to accommodate up to 2,000 tests per day, beginning Tuesday, Feb. 1, 2022.

items.title: Board of Supervisors Authorizes County to Distribute Surplus Safety Equipment
items.summary: Dozens of nonprofit organizations and government agencies will receive surplus gowns, goggles and cleaning materials initially purchased for COVID-19 protection following the Board of Supervisors today authorizing the county manager to distribute the supplies.

items.title: Statement From County Manager Mike Callagy Regarding Safety Equipment at the Event Center
items.summary: &nbsp;Surplus safety equipment and cleaning supplies purchased in response to COVID-19 were moved outside at the San Mateo Event Center last fall to accommodate an event and sustained damage during the significant storms earlier this season.

items.title: County Encourages Masking, Testing and Boosters to Battle Surge in Omicron Variant
items.summary:
Test kits to be distributed for children in low-income families,&nbsp;vulnerable residents and workers

Redwood City – The County of San Mateo expects to maintain current health and safety protocols to keep schools and the economy open and avoid coronavirus-related shutdowns.
